TypeDefinition.Description: Storage target device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Device
TypeDefinition.Name: StorageDevice

TypeDefinition.Description: Pool number. Be sure to specify this parameter when creating a virtual volume from a pool.
TypeDefinition.Label: Pool Id
TypeDefinition.Name: PoolId

TypeDefinition.Description: Parity group number. Be sure to specify this parameter when creating an LDEV (basic volume). If specified at the same time as Pool ID, this parameter will be ignored.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parity Group
TypeDefinition.Name: ParityGroupId

TypeDefinition.Description: External parity group number. Be sure to specify this parameter when creating an external volume. If specified at the same time as Pool ID or Parity Group ID, this parameter will be ignored.
TypeDefinition.Label: External Parity Group
TypeDefinition.Name: ExternalParityGroupId

TypeDefinition.Description: To specify label for volume.
TypeDefinition.Label: Volume Label
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeLabel

TypeDefinition.Description: Whether to enable the capacity saving function (dedupe and compression).
TypeDefinition.Label: Data Reduction Mode
TypeDefinition.Name: DataReductionMode

TypeDefinition.Description: It updates the virtual size of the volume. The size must be a number (used in conjunction with unit).
TypeDefinition.Label: Size
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeSize

TypeDefinition.Description: Unit is a string with a single character unit symbol. Valid unit symbols are KiB, MiB, GiB, TiB and PiB representing Bytes, Kilobyte, Megabyte, Gigabyte, Terabyte, and Petabyte respectively, where one Kilobyte equals 1024 Bytes, one Megabyte equals 1048576 Bytes and so on.
TypeDefinition.Label: Unit
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeUnit

Body.Description: Platform(s) supported for storage target devices.
Body.Label: Storage Platform Type
Body.Name: StoragePlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type for storage target device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: StoragePlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: StorageVirtualMachineName can be between 1 and 47 characters long depending on the device target selected it may vary and with first character being alphanumeric or underscore (_) and containing alphanumeric characters and ".", "-" or "_" allowed.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Virtual Machine
TypeDefinition.Name: StorageVirtualMachineName

Body.Description: NetApp Aggregate used for creating the volume.
Body.Label: NetApp Aggregate Type
Body.Name: NetAppAggregateType

TypeDefinition.Description: Name of the aggregate.
TypeDefinition.Label: Aggregate
TypeDefinition.Name: Aggregate

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: List of aggregates.
TypeDefinition.Label: Storage Aggregates
TypeDefinition.Name: StorageAggregates

InventorySelector.Selector: /api/v1/search/SearchItems?$filter=(((IndexMotypes eq storage.BaseVolume) and ( ObjectType ne storage.NetAppLun)) or (IndexMotypes eq storage.BaseStorageContainer) )&$orderby=Name&$select=Name

TypeDefinition.Description: If set to true, NFS volume will be created and if set to false, SAN volume will be created.
TypeDefinition.Label: NFS
TypeDefinition.Name: Nfs

TypeDefinition.Description: Mount path for the volume eg. /volume3.
TypeDefinition.Label: Mount Path
TypeDefinition.Name: MountPath

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: Volume name must be between 1 and 63 alpha-numeric characters, and depending on the device target selected the limit may vary. The first and last character must be alphanumeric and name may also contain hyphen (-) character.
TypeDefinition.Label: Volume
TypeDefinition.Name: VolumeName

TypeDefinition.Description: Hitachi Volume Option
TypeDefinition.Label: Hitachi volume option.
TypeDefinition.Name: HitachiVolumeOptions

TypeDefinition.Description: NFS volume option.
TypeDefinition.Label: NFS Volume Option
TypeDefinition.Name: NfsVolumeOptions

TypeDefinition.Description: Platform type of the storage device.
TypeDefinition.Label: Platform Type
TypeDefinition.Name: PlatformType

TypeDefinition.Description: Forcibly deletes the DP volume for which the capacity saving function (compression or deduplication) is enabled.
TypeDefinition.Label: Force Delete
TypeDefinition.Name: ForceDelete

Body.Description: Remove Storage Volume with Volume name as input. On successful execution, the deleted Volume name is generated as output.
Body.Label: Remove Storage Volume
Body.Name: RemoveStorageVolume

InputDefinition.Description: Volume name must be between 1 and 63 alpha-numeric characters, and depending on the device target selected the limit may vary. The first and last character must be alphanumeric and name may also contain hyphen (-) character.
InputDefinition.Label: Volume
InputDefinition.Name: VolumeName

Body.Description: Create a storage volume with volume name and volume size as inputs. Generates the volume name and volume size as outputs.
Body.Label: New Storage Volume
Body.Name: NewStorageVolume

Tasks.Description: A Parallel Loop is a control task that runs one task or one sub-workflow multiple times based on a specified count.  The count can be a static value that is specified during design time or a dynamic value that is derived from workflow inputs or task outputs.  When the loop is executed, the count 'N' is determined, N tasks or sub-workflows are scheduled for execution in parallel.  When all N instances of the task or sub-workflow reach a final state the parallel loop will complete and workflow execution will move on to the next task.  If any one of the tasks or sub-workflows fails, then the entire loop will fail.  Dynamic values for count must be specified as a template.  For example, if a loop must run for a count which matches the length of a workflow input called StringArray, then the count must be specified using a template '{{ len .global.workflow.input.StringArray }}'.  The iteration of the loop is available using the keyword '.iteration' and it can be used to control inputs that feed into the task.  For example, the task inside the loop needs to take one value from the workflow input StringArray, then the task string input can be mapped to the template '{{ index .global.workflow.input.StringArray .iteration}}' during design.
Tasks.Label: Parallel Loop
Tasks.Name: parallelLoop1
